page.title: 01MELKSHAM - AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: Melksham, a town on the river Avon, is surrounded by unspoilt scenery. It is expanding rapidly due to many new estates and the recent reopening of the railway. The origin of the town can be traced back to before the Doomsday record, but the only building with a trace of this is the parish church. However, there are still many other buildings of interest. For example the stone houses in Church Street, or the Georgian and Regency houses in Spa Road. The local government has 12 councillors. The town is divided into 4 Wards; Roundpond, Forest, Lambourne and Town. Melksham falls into the Westbury constituency of Parliament, and the Wessex European Parliamentary constituency.
